alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 2:05PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Ponding of water in low-lying areas and small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following county, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Streams and creeks running high. Water over a few back roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 205 PM MDT, Local law enforcement and Emergency Management personnel reported that minor flooding due to snowmelt continues across the advisory area. Many fields have standing water, creeks and streams are running high, and a few back roads are affected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Preston, Franklin, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Thatcher, Dayton, Weston, Clifton, Oxford, Riverdale, Mink Creek, Whitney, Mapleton and Emmigrant Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to the National Weather Service office in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, when you can do so safely.
